translation.source: Some types of glands release their secretions in specific areas.
translation.target: Àwọn ẹṣẹ́-ojera kan a máa sun ojera wọn sí àgbèègbè ibi kan.

translation.source: Sedimentary rock: Rock formed from the deposit of sediments
translation.target: Àpáta ìsilẹ: Àpáta tó wáyé nigbati awọn gẹ̀dẹ̀gẹ́dẹ̀ ile bá kóra jọ ti wọn sì di líle

translation.source: Geology - Science of the earth: is the science comprising of the study of solid Earth and the processes by which it evolves.
translation.target: Ẹ̀kọ́ Ìṣẹ̀dálẹ-ayé jẹ́ ẹ̀kọ́ nípa orílẹ ayé àti gbogbo àwọn ọnà tí ó gbà yà.

translation.source: For defending the body by fighting any disease that enters the body
translation.target: Fún ìgbèjà ara nípa bíbá àwọn ẹ̀dá-afàìsàn tó bá wọ inú ara jà

translation.source: The largest organ in the body, is the skin
translation.target: Awọ ara ní ẹ̀yà-ara tó tóbi ju ní ara ọmọ-ènìyàn

translation.source: The Integumentary System is the largest organ system in the human body
translation.target: Ètò Awọ-ara jẹ́ ètò ẹ̀yà-ara tó tóbi jù ní ara ọmọ ènìyàn

translation.source: No statement is scientific unless it is falsifiable.
translation.target: Eyi si fun wa laye lati le dan arosọ yi wo, ki a si yẹ ẹ wo fin-ni-fin-ni.

translation.source: Capillaries are very thin, fragile blood vessels that receive oxygen-rich blood from arteries
translation.target: Àwọn òpó-ẹ̀jẹ̀ jẹ́ àwọn òpó tinrin-tinrin tí wọn ngba ẹ̀jẹ̀ tó kún fún òyì-iná láti ọwọ àwọn ìṣọ̀n-ẹ̀jẹ̀ àlọ

translation.source: It detects a wide variety of agents, from viruses to parasitic worms, and needs to distinguish them from the organism's own healthy cells and tissues in order to function properly.
translation.target: Ó nṣe àfarahàn ọpọlọpọ àwọn àlejò ara, bẹrẹ láti àwọn ọlọjẹ (viruses) títídé àwọn aràn ajọfẹ. Ó sì níláti ṣe ìdáyàtọ láarín àwọn yi àti àwọn pádi ara fúnraarẹ àti àwọn ìṣù-ara rẹ láti lè ṣiṣẹ́ tó wuyì.

translation.source: Sandstone: sedimentary rock with colour ranging from yellow to red
translation.target: Egúrù, egúnrìn: Àpáta ìsìlẹ tó ní àwọn awọ bí àyìnrín sí pupa

translation.source: Bone marrow: All the cells of the immune system are initially derived from the bone marrow.
translation.target: Ìmùdùnmúdùn ẹ̀jẹ̀: Gbogbo àwọn pádi ti ètò òkí-ara tó ṣẹ láti imùdùnmúdùn ẹ̀jẹ̀.

translation.source: Science is a method of inquiry that sets up falsifiable hypothesis and tests them.
translation.target: Ẹ̀kọ́ ìmọ̀-jinlẹ jẹ ilana bi a ti nṣewadi ohunkohun nipa iṣarosọ (ṣe arosọ: hypothesize) ti o le mu ki ariyanjiyan waye.

translation.source: Endocrine glands, on the other hand, release more than 20 major hormones directly into the bloodstream where they can be transported to cells in other parts of the body.
translation.target: Àwọn ẹṣẹ́-ojera àìlópo, nṣe àtúsílẹ nkan bí ogun ojera sínú òpó-ẹ̀jẹ̀ tààrà nibi tí wọn ti léè gbé wọn lọ sí àwọn pádi miran ní apá ara tí wọn ti wúlò.

translation.source: The sexual or asexual process by which organisms generate new individuals of the same kind.
translation.target: Bíbí ti lákọlábo tàbí ti ògbo jẹ́ ìlànà bí àwọn ẹ̀dá oníyè ti nṣe ìpilẹṣẹ àwọn ẹ̀dá bíi ti ara wọn.
